intro: Tylophora sarasinorum, commonly known as the Sarawak Tylophora, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often found in tropical rainforests, growing along forest edges or in shaded undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of tropical flora and traditional medicine.
